short_summary: The Government of Canada requires a support services provider to plan, manage, and perform the divestiture of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation (FFMC).
description: The goal is to transform the FFMC's governance and ownership model in a way that will promote Indigenous economic reconciliation, Indigenous participation, and continued service to northern, remote, and Indigenous communities and with the aim of providing continued marketing services to the communities that it serves.
full_summary:
---

### TSPS - Support Services for the Divestiture and Transformation of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation

#### Title  | Description
---------|-------------
English    | TSPS - Support Services for the Divestiture and Transformation of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation
French     | SPTS - Services de Soutien pour le Désinvestissement et la Transformation de la Société de Commercialisation du Poisson d’Eau Douce

#### Solicitation Details
*   **Solicitation Reference #:** cb-276-95715086
*   **Solicitation Name:** 30005540
*   **Publication Date:** April 10, 2024
*   **Tender Closing Date:** April 29, 2024, 14:00:00
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** May 7, 2024
*   **Expected Contract End Date:** May 30, 2026

#### Tender Details
*   **Tender Status:** Expired
*   **Procurement Category:** SRV
*   **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering
*   **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
*   **Selection Criteria:** Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

#### Services
The Government of Canada seeks a support services provider to plan, manage, and execute the divestiture of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation (FFMC) under the direction of Fisheries and Oceans Canada. This divestiture will aim to establish a negotiated agreement with an approved buyer for the purchase and ownership of the FFMC within approximately two years.

The contracted services will transform the FFMC’s governance and ownership model to promote Indigenous economic reconciliation, Indigenous participation, and continued service to northern, remote, and Indigenous communities. The services will also provide continued marketing services to the communities the FFMC serves.

The candidate provider must be able to plan, manage, and execute the divestiture, which will include:

*   Procuring a negotiated agreement with an approved buyer
*   Transforming the FFMC’s governance and ownership model
*   Providing continued marketing services to the communities the FFMC serves

only those suppliers who are academic academics and případně classified under Stream 1 and Category 2 are eligible to participate.

*   For suppliers who are SA-holders: request to be invited from the DFO Procurement Officer then check with PSPC's SA Authority which shows proof of being qualified as a Stream 1 and Category 2
